prototypes.prototype: Result_String as C = UI_GET_LIST_ARRAY(C title,N default_choice,C array_name)
Result_String as C = UI_GET_LIST_ARRAY( Title as C, Default_Choice as N, Array_Name as C [, Sizeable as L [, Xpos, Ypos [, Xsize, Ysize ]]] )

argument.name: title
argument.description: The title of the dialog box.

argument.name: default_choice
argument.description: Determines which list box entry is selected when the dialog box first appears. This parameter is a numeric value indicating which item is to be selected (from 1 to the last element of the array). For example, if the Default_Choice is 5, the fifth list box entry is highlighted when the dialog box appears.

argument.name: array_name
argument.description: A character string containing the name of a defined array. You must declare this array as an array of character strings. For example, the following statement displays the contents of the Company array: ui_get_list_array("Choose a Company Name", 1, "Company").

argument.name: Sizeable
argument.description: Optional. Default = .F. Determines if the dialog can be resized by the user.

argument.name: Xpos and Ypos
argument.description: Optional. Parameters that determine where on the screen the dialog is displayed. Both parameters must be between 0.0 and 1.0, where 0 represents the top (or left) corner of the screen, and 1 represents the bottom (or right) corner. Xpos and Ypos values of 0.5 and 0.5, for example, represent the center of the screen.

argument.name: Xsize and Ysize
argument.description: Optional. Parameters that determine the size of the dialog. Both parameters must be between 0.0 and 1.0, where 1 represents the full width or height of the screen. Xsize and Ysize values of 0.25 and 0.25, for example, represent a dialog that fills one quarter of the screen.

page.description: Prompt user for selection from list.
page.discussion: UI_GET_LIST_ARRAY() displays a dialog box with a list box filled with the contents of a character array. Your response is returned as a Result_String that contains the contents of the listbox entry that you either double-clicked or highlighted before you clicked the dialog box's OK button. This function is useful for selecting a value from the contents of an array. The Result_String will be empty ("") if the Cancel button is selected. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: Populate an array with all the fields in the current table.
section.example: dim fields[1024] as C tbl = table.current() number_of_fields = tbl.fields_get() for i = 1 TO number_of_fields fld = tbl.field_get(i) 'get a pointer to field I name = fld.name_get() 'get the name of this field fields[I] = name next i
